column4: i have put my HDD in a new MB and i have problems with the usb drivers how can i DL drivers?
i have put my HDD in a new MB and i have problems with the usb drivers how can i DL drivers?
it's quite unusual to need usb drivers for hdd
no cuz my hdd with ubuntu is on a new MB i need drivers for my new MB
ok, now I understand.. well.. it's still kind of unusal.. most motherboard stuff usually works without separate drivers... what makes you think it's a driver problem?
cuz i cant put usb :) dunno
look in dmesg and /var/log/syslog for errors..
cuz few weeks ago i had to dl some drivers. but i didnt
well.. lets see what those logs tell us.. can you pastebin them?
/dev/dsp and /dev/audio?
tell us about this problem
I think /dev/audio and /dev/dsp is used by oss, the older sound system that predates alsa..
nothing in the repos?
I think it's called seamonkey these days.. if you mean the old mozilla browser
since you asked like that I assume you're not experienced with packaging.. or?
what do you want to do?
i am trying to install JMF
and why do you need to create a deb from a bin-file?
cuz when i install it like bin it cant be installed i dont know i want to try the easyest way deb :P
the reason a deb is easier is because someone else has done a lot of the hard work.. you can't just run a command and convert it
you'd be better off trying to install it from the bin file.. if it isn't already available in the repos but I guess you've checked that
